alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 1:30PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Jackson, northeastern Madison and southeastern Franklin Counties through 215 PM CDT... At 130 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles south of Huntland, or 17 miles east of Moores Mill, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Stevenson, Skyline, Anderson, Hytop, Bass, Francisco, Princeton, Jericho, Russell Cave National Monument and Estillfork. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for north central and northeastern Alabama...and Middle Tennessee.
